name: ai-browser
description: ðŸ¤– An AI-powered desktop automation agent built with Electron &   Next.js - Control your computer like manus, but as a native   desktop app, an ai browser!
readme_summary: The ai-browser repository is an AI-powered desktop automation agent built with Next.js and Electron. It allows users to control their computer like a native desktop application, leveraging multi-modal AI task execution, scheduled tasks, social media integration, and advanced file management with support for multiple AI providers.
key_features: Multiple AI Providers (DeepSeek, Qwen, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, OpenRouter)
UI Configuration for AI models and API keys
Agent Configuration with custom prompts and MCP tools
AI-Powered Browser with automated task execution
primary_use_case: AI-powered desktop automation and intelligent browsing.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled clockmaker meticulously assembling gears inside a desktop computer, each gear representing a different AI provider (DeepSeek, Qwen, Gemini, Claude). The clockmaker uses a magnifying glass to examine data streams flowing between the gears, ensuring smooth automation. A small UI element on the computer screen displays a list of scheduled tasks. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, organized aesthetic. Digital particles subtly highlight the flow of data. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: pluGET
description: ðŸššðŸ’¨ Powerful Package manager which updates plugins & server software for minecraft servers
readme_summary: pluGET is a Python-based package manager designed to simplify the management of Minecraft server plugins and server software. It automates the process of checking for updates and downloading the latest versions of plugins from sources like Spigot, Modrinth, and GitHub, as well as server software like PaperMC and Purpur. It supports both local and remote servers via SFTP/FTP.
key_features: Checks for updates and downloads latest plugin versions
Checks for updates and downloads latest server software versions (PaperMC, Purpur, Waterfall, Velocity)
primary_use_case: Automating the management and updating of Minecraft server plugins and server software.
cover_image_prompt: A diligent librarian meticulously organizing and updating books (plugins) on towering shelves (Minecraft server). The librarian uses a magnifying glass (pluGET) to check each book's version against a digital catalog displayed on a nearby screen. Books with outdated versions are automatically replaced by newer editions delivered by a miniature delivery drone. The shelves are labeled with recognizable Minecraft plugin logos. The scene is set in a bright, organized library with subtle digital particles floating around the books. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.

name: librepods
readme_summary: LibrePods is a Kotlin-based project aiming to unlock Apple's AirPods features on non-Apple devices, specifically Android and Linux. It provides access to features like noise control, ear detection, and battery status, effectively liberating AirPods from the Apple ecosystem.
primary_use_case: Enabling full AirPods functionality, including noise control, ear detection, and customized settings, on Android and Linux devices.
cover_image_prompt: An audio engineer stands at a mixing console, connecting AirPods to a variety of non-Apple devices (Android phone, Linux laptop). The console has glowing knobs and sliders controlling noise cancellation, transparency, and EQ settings. Visual indicators show audio waves flowing freely between the AirPods and the devices, bypassing a large, locked Apple-shaped gate. Small UI elements display the LibrePods app interface on each device. The scene is set in a modern recording studio with soft, ambient lighting. The composition is focused and balanced with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: OpenEmu
description: ðŸ•¹ Retro video game emulation for macOS
readme_summary: OpenEmu is an open-source macOS application that emulates retro video game consoles. It uses a modular architecture, allowing it to support various game engines as plugins, providing a unified and native macOS front end for playing classic games.
key_features: macOS native front end for emulation
Modular architecture with game engine plugins
Leverages macOS technologies like Cocoa, Metal, and Core Animation
primary_use_case: Playing retro video games on macOS using a single, unified application.
cover_image_prompt: A museum curator carefully placing various classic video game cartridges (Atari, NES, Game Boy, etc.) into a glowing, futuristic display case labeled "OpenEmu." The display case projects holographic images of the games being played. The curator wears a lab coat and uses digital tools to analyze and organize the cartridges. Small UI elements showing game selection and settings are subtly visible on the display case. The scene is set in a brightly lit, modern museum exhibit. The composition is clean and focused with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and clear iconography.

name: AIPex
description: AIPex: agentic assistant in your browser, automate your browser using natural language. ChatGPT Atlas Alternative, Alaternative to Manus Browser Operator.
readme_summary: AIPex is an open-source Chrome extension that automates browser tasks using natural language commands, positioning itself as an alternative to ChatGPT Atlas. It allows users to automate workflows and repetitive actions directly within their existing browser, eliminating the need for browser migration and offering feature parity with enhanced performance.
key_features: Browser automation using natural language commands
Open source alternative to ChatGPT Atlas
Complete feature parity with ChatGPT Atlas
Optimized performance for speed and efficiency
primary_use_case: Automating browser tasks using natural language commands.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot butler standing in front of a browser window, listening attentively to a user giving instructions. The butler is holding a tray with icons representing different browser tasks (e.g., filling forms, clicking buttons, navigating pages). The browser window displays a simplified interface with a chat box. Subtle digital particles float around the butler, visualizing the AI processing the commands. The repository name 'AIPex' is subtly displayed on the butler's apron. The scene is set in a bright, modern office. The image should be in a flat design style with clear iconography and a vibrant color scheme.

name: C-Compile-Helper
readme_summary: The C++ Compile Helper is a Python script designed to simplify the compilation of C/C++ files. It automatically detects available compilers, validates their functionality, and provides a user-friendly interface for compiling code without the complexities of build systems. It is primarily aimed at beginners who need a simple way to compile C++ code.
primary_use_case: Simplifying C/C++ compilation for beginners and users who prefer not to use complex build systems.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a helpful robot chef in a kitchen, effortlessly taking raw code ingredients (C++ files) and placing them into different compiler ovens. Each oven is labeled with a compiler name (GCC, Clang, etc.). The robot then pulls out perfectly compiled executables, presenting them on a serving platter. Small screens display compilation arguments and success messages. The kitchen is clean and modern, with subtle digital particles floating around the robot. The repository name is subtly displayed on the robot's apron. The scene is brightly lit and inviting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: scl
description: NEW REPOSITORY WITH SUPPORT FOR RUST, GO, ELIXIR, RUBY, C, AND MORE: https://github.com/shareui/scl
readme_summary: The SCL repository defines a new configuration language with features like strong typing, nested objects, typed lists, and multiline strings. It aims to provide a human-friendly configuration format and currently has a Python library available, with plans for libraries in other languages like Kotlin, Java, Rust, Elixir, Ruby, and JavaScript/TypeScript.
key_features: Strong typing with explicit type declarations
Typed lists supporting num, fl, bool, str
primary_use_case: Defining configuration files in a simple, readable, and strongly-typed format.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect meticulously crafting a blueprint for a futuristic city using building blocks of various shapes and colors, each representing different data types (strings, numbers, booleans). The architect uses a special lens to ensure each block perfectly fits into the overall structure, symbolizing strong typing and validation. A holographic display shows the blueprint transforming into a functional city, representing the configuration in action. Small UI elements display code snippets and data structures. The scene is set in a brightly lit studio with a clean, focused composition. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.
